name: Allison Randal
biography: Allison Randal is a Program Chair for O’Reilly’s Open Source Convention. Her first geek career was as a research linguist in eastern Africa. But eventually her love of coding drew her away from natural languages to artificial ones. Allison is the architect of Parrot (a virtual machine for dynamic languages), on the board of directors of the Python Software Foundation, the Parrot Foundation, and The Perl Foundation, and founder and president of Onyx Neon Press.
